channel.title: Fizz Buzz Test

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

I would personally never use [i]system("PAUSE")[/i] (it's a machine-dependant 'hack', horrendous and I think there are legitimate concerns regarding its use, i would just use [i]cin >> placeholder[/i] to pause my application).

Yes, thank you for this. I’ve read that it isn’t really a good way to “pause” the prompt, and thank you for letting me know about an alternative way!

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:62, topic:540269”]Just started C++ last night… Here’s what I got:

[code=cpp]#include
using namespace std;

int main()
{
for (int i = 1; i <= 100; i++)
{
if (i % 3 == 0 && i % 5 == 0)
{
cout << “fizzbuzz\n”;
}
else if (i % 3 == 0)
{
cout << “buzz\n”;
}
else if (i % 5 == 0)
{
cout << “fizz\n”;
}
else
{
cout << i << “\n”;
}
}
system(“PAUSE”);
return 0;
}[/code][/quote]You can combine your first if-check into a single expression (i % 15 == 0) and I would personally never use system(“PAUSE”) (it’s a machine-dependant ‘hack’, horrendous and I think there are legitimate concerns regarding its use, i would just use cin >> placeholder to pause my application).

Read full topic

system(“PAUSE”);

HAI 1.2

I HAS A FIZZ, I HAS A BUZZ, I HAS A BAZZ
I HAS A FIZZBUZZ, I HAS A FIZZBAZZ, I HAS A BUZZBAZZ
I HAS A END ITZ 100

IM IN YR LOOP UPPIN YR START TIL BOTH SAEM START AN END

	I HAS A START ITZ SUM OF 1 AN START

	FIZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 3, BUZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 5
	BAZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 7, FIZZBUZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 15
	FIZZBAZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 21, BUZZBAZZ R NOT MOD OF START AN 35

	BUZZBAZZ, O RLY?, YA RLY, VISIBLE "BUZZBAZZ"
		MEBBE FIZZBAZZ, VISIBLE "FIZZBAZZ", MEBBE FIZZBUZZ, VISIBLE "FIZZBUZZ"
		MEBBE BAZZ, VISIBLE "BAZZ", MEBBE BUZZ, VISIBLE "BUZZ"
		MEBBE FIZZ, VISIBLE "FIZZ"
	NO WAI
		VISIBLE START
	OIC
IM OUTTA YR LOOP

KTHXBYE[/code]
[/quote]

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:59, topic:540269”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=659126.msg4409373#msg4409373 date=1393033889]

for (int i = 1; i < 101; i++) System.out.println((i % 3 == 0 ? "Fizz" : i % 5 == 0 ? "Buzz" : i % 3 == 7 && i % 5 == 0 ? "FizzBuzz" : "" + i));
[/quote]Your example (which you now removed) was incorrect, just a small typo.

Yeah, I didn’t test it out, which was a mistake :/. I tested it after I posted lol, but I fixed it.[/quote]I would have done it like this, if I wanted to take your approach at all…

for (int i = 1; i < 101; i++) { String string = ""; if (i % 3 == 0) { string += "Fizz"; } if (i % 5 == 0) { string += "Buzz"; } System.out.println(string.length() == 0 ? i : string); }

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:56, topic:540269”] for (int i = 1; i < 101; i++) System.out.println((i % 3 == 0 ? "Fizz" : i % 5 == 0 ? "Buzz" : i % 3 == 7 && i % 5 == 0 ? "FizzBuzz" : "" + i));[/quote]Your example (which you now removed) was incorrect, just a small typo.

edit: Also your FizzBuzz check had to be before the rest of the statements, since i % 3 or i % 5 would have been caught earlier.

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Java can’t get as confusing as Ruby.

for (int i = 1; i < 101; i++) {
	String string = (i % 3 != 0 && i % 5 != 0 ? ""+i : "");
	if (i % 3 == 0) string += "Fizz";
	if (i % 5 == 0) string += "Buzz";
	System.out.println(string);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Here it is in perfect compiler

[code]@echo off
for /L %%i in (1,1,100) do call :tester %%i
goto :eof

:tester
set /a test = %1 %% 15
if %test% NEQ 0 goto :NotFizzBuzz
echo FizzBuzz
goto :eof

:NotFizzBuzz
set /a test = %1 %% 5
if %test% NEQ 0 goto :NotBuzz
echo Buzz
goto :eof

:NotBuzz
set /a test = %1 %% 3
if %test% NEQ 0 goto :NotFizz
echo Fizz
goto :eof

:NotFizz
echo %1[/code]

Read full topic

}

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:41, topic:540269”]Now suppose I introduce the constraint that if a multiple of 7 is found, “Bazz” shall be printed. As with before, If a number is a multiple of 7 and another number (3 or 5), all the appropriate words should be printed (e.g multiples of 3*7 =21 should print FizzBazz etc)

brb watching people struggle to adapt their solutions

[code=java]
import java.util.*;

public class Test {
private class Pair<V,K> {
public V first;
public K second;

	public Pair(V first, K second) {
		this.first = first;
		this.second = second;
	}
}

private ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>> multiples;

public Test() {
	multiples = new ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>>();
}

public boolean addMultiple(int i, String word) {
	return multiples.add(new Pair<Integer,String>(i,word));
}

public void printTest(int n) {
	for(int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
		System.out.println(getText(i));
	}
}

private String getText(int i) {
	String number = "";
	for(Pair<Integer,String> multiple : multiples) {
		if((i % multiple.first) == 0) {
			number+=multiple.second;
		}
	}
	if(number.equals("")) {
		number = Integer.toString(i);
	}
	return number;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
	Test t = new Test();
	t.addMultiple(3,"Fizz");
	t.addMultiple(5,"Buzz");
	t.addMultiple(7,"Bazz");
	t.printTest(100);
}

}
[/code][/quote]

I like this one. You shall live.

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:41, topic:540269”]Now suppose I introduce the constraint that if a multiple of 7 is found, “Bazz” shall be printed. As with before, If a number is a multiple of 7 and another number (3 or 5), all the appropriate words should be printed (e.g multiples of 3*7 =21 should print FizzBazz etc)

brb watching people struggle to adapt their solutions :)[/quote]

(let* [(x '((3 . "Fizz") (5 . "Buzz") (7 . "Bazz"))) (fn (lambda (i) (foldl (lambda (arg str) (if (= (modulo i (car arg)) 0) (string-append str (cdr arg)) str)) "" x)))] (do [(i 1 (+ i 1))] ((> i 100) (void)) (let [(str (fn i))] (printf "~a" (if (string=? str "") i str)) (newline))))

Fully extendable for any pair (naming is a bit poor but fudge it).

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

package test

class FizzBuzz {

	def static void main(String[] args) {
		(1 ..< 101).forEach [ index |
			val bldr = new StringBuilder
			if (index % 3 == 0) {
				bldr.append('fizz')
			}
			if (index % 5 == 0) {
				bldr.append('buzz')
			}
			if (index % 7 == 0) {
				bldr.append('bazz')
			}
			if (bldr.length == 0) {
				bldr.append(index)
			}
			println(bldr.toString)
		]
	}

}

Read full topic

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Snow_, post:42, topic:540269”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=659126.msg4408597#msg4408597 date=1392811520]
Now suppose I introduce the constraint that if a multiple of 7 is found, “Bazz” shall be printed. As with before, If a number is a multiple of 7 and another number (3 or 5), all the appropriate words should be printed (e.g multiples of 3*7 =21 should print FizzBazz etc)

brb watching people struggle to adapt their solutions
[/quote]

for (int i = 0; i < 100; i++) { System.out.println((i % 3 == 0 ? "Fizz" : "") + (i % 5 == 0 ? "Buzz" : "") + (i % 7 == 0 ? "Bazz" : "") + (i % 3 != 0 && i % 5 != 0 && i % 7 != 0 ? i : "")); } [/quote]Disgusting.

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:41, topic:540269”]Now suppose I introduce the constraint that if a multiple of 7 is found, “Bazz” shall be printed. As with before, If a number is a multiple of 7 and another number (3 or 5), all the appropriate words should be printed (e.g multiples of 3*7 =21 should print FizzBazz etc)

brb watching people struggle to adapt their solutions

[code=java]
import java.util.*;

public class Test {
private class Pair<V,K> {
public V first;
public K second;

	public Pair(V first, K second) {
		this.first = first;
		this.second = second;
	}
}

private ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>> multiples;

public Test() {
	multiples = new ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>>();
}

public boolean addMultiple(int i, String word) {
	return multiples.add(new Pair<Integer,String>(i,word));
}

public void printTest(int n) {
	for(int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
		System.out.println(getText(i));
	}
}

private String getText(int i) {
	String number = "";
	for(Pair<Integer,String> multiple : multiples) {
		if((i % multiple.first) == 0) {
			number+=multiple.second;
		}
	}
	if(number.equals("")) {
		number = Integer.toString(i);
	}
	return number;
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
	Test t = new Test();
	t.addMultiple(3,"Fizz");
	t.addMultiple(5,"Buzz");
	t.addMultiple(7,"Bazz");
	t.printTest(100);
}

}
[/code][/quote]This looks decent but I think it might be overkill, I’ll see what I get up to in a bit.

item.title: Fizz Buzz Test
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Now suppose I introduce the constraint that if a multiple of 7 is found, “Bazz” shall be printed. As with before, If a number is a multiple of 7 and another number (3 or 5), all the appropriate words should be printed (e.g multiples of 3*7 =21 should print FizzBazz etc)

brb watching people struggle to adapt their solutions 

import java.util.*;

public class Test {
	private class Pair<V,K> {
		public V first;
		public K second;

		public Pair(V first, K second) {
			this.first = first;
			this.second = second;
		}
	}

	private ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>> multiples;

	public Test() {
		multiples = new ArrayList<Pair<Integer,String>>();
	}

	public boolean addMultiple(int i, String word) {
		return multiples.add(new Pair<Integer,String>(i,word));
	}

	public void printTest(int n) {
		for(int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
			System.out.println(getText(i));
		}
	}

	private String getText(int i) {
		String number = "";
		for(Pair<Integer,String> multiple : multiples) {
			if((i % multiple.first) == 0) {
				number+=multiple.second;
			}
		}
		if(number.equals("")) {
			number = Integer.toString(i);
		}
		return number;
	}

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Test t = new Test();
		t.addMultiple(3,"Fizz");
		t.addMultiple(5,"Buzz");
		t.addMultiple(7,"Bazz");
		t.printTest(100);
	}
}

Read full topic
